title: GRAVITY instrument breaks new ground in exoplanet imaging

title_detail.value: GRAVITY instrument breaks new ground in exoplanet imaging

summary: The GRAVITY instrument on ESO's Very Large Telescope Interferometer (VLTI) has made the first direct observation of an exoplanet using optical interferometry. This method revealed a complex exoplanetary atmosphere with clouds of iron and silicates swirling in a planet-wide storm. The technique presents unique possibilities for characterizing many of the exoplanets known today.
